subject: On the Road Again
event:
This will no doubt upset all those readers who want me to stay home and write, write, write, but it looks as though I will be taking to the road again in the fall.

If you've ever looked at the Knights page of my website, you'll know about my passion for collecting 54mm toy knights and medieval miniatures.  The "worldcon" for toy soldier collectors is the Old Toy Soldier Show, held every September at the Hyatt Regency Hotel in Schaumberg, Illinois, outside of Chicago.  I have had to miss the last couple of OTS shows, but I'm returning this year.

And then there's Archon, the regional in St. Louis, which I've been attending since 1977.  I have missed a couple of those in recent years as well, but once again I mean to return this year.

Usually the Old Toy Soldier Show and Archon are only one week apart, so I fly into Chicago, do the show, rent a car, make a leisurely drive down to St. Louis, and fly home from there.  This year, however, the events are TWO weeks apart, so I had to determine whether I'd make two trips, or just linger in the midwest a little longer than usual.

I decided on the former, since it gives me the chance to visit a few other cities, and see some fannish friends that I don't see often enough.  So after Chicago, I am going to visit Indianapolis and Cincinnati (where I'll catch the first day of the fabulous Tall Stacks steamboat festival, a fun event that never fails to awaken memories of FEVRE DREAM for me), and only then turn toward St. Louis.

And as it happens, this is just about the time that Starscape Books will be releasing its illustrated hardcover edition of THE ICE DRAGON, with the lovely Yvonne Gilbert artwork, so I am going to combine some business with my pleasure and do a few bookstore appearances as well.  I will be signing at a Border's in Chicago, at a Barnes & Noble in Indianapolis, at Joe Beth in Cincinnati, and at Border's in St. Louis (must admit to having some trepidations about the last, given what happened the last time I signed at a bookstore in St. Louis while Archon was going on thirty miles away in Collinsville, Illinois, but maybe this time will turn out better).  Details of times and places will be posted on my Appearances page.

If you missed me on my last swing on the midwest, here's your chance.

comments.upictitle: I'm just your average Thundercats ho': HarleyQ
comments.article: Errr, so wait - it sounds like you're lingering, so I assume you meant "the latter"?? ;0P Either way, I'm geeked about the linger, as the midwest is, woefully, a vast cultural wasteland. I'd advise you to add Iowa to your list, but it would be for purely selfish reasons, as I can't in good conscience recommend this place to tourists hah! Believe me, though, your fans here are plentiful, and I know that several of us will be bound for some of the closer signings (the first time I saw you was a 4hr drive away in Minneapolis, so close is definitely relative in the midwest!)
Yeah, I was going to beg that he come back to Madison, but beggers can't be choosers :)

I think this is the only time I've ever wished I were in the midwest! :) Have a good trip George.

Alex

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: The classic madbard
comments.article: Remember that if you enjoy too much leisure, your ability to torment your characters slowly atrophies!

comments.upictitle: Kalihira, Goddess of Oceans and Afterlife: Until the End of Time
comments.article: Which Borders in St. Louis are you planning on doing your signing? I would love to get my copy of A Game Of Thrones signed without having to shell out the $45 for a one day pass to Archon. I'm sort of cheap! >_
Awesome icon. :D
I saw you in Indianapolis last winter, but I will absolutely be there again! I'll be the one asking a lot of irritating questions about Jon's lineage. :)
That last was me; I should not post while drunk.

I know if possible I will try to make the signing in Chicago.  Could be iffy, if it's on a weeknight, but since I made the "mistake" of turning my mother onto your work, I would love to get her a signed copy of The Ice Dragon.  She's an elementary school librarian, so see, it's not just fandom anymore, it's *marketing*. :D

Hi George,

You could try having your agent send a press release or perhaps try to get you an interview on our local NPR station (KWMU) there is a program called Cityscape, and another called St. Louis On The Air that highlight local events. That may help your local fans who can't make it to Archon find you.

Do you know which Borders you'll be signing for? I'd love to come say hello.

Tamela
comments.subject: On the road: St. Lou book signings

comments.article: Brentwood and Hwy 40.. or so I've heard. ;D
comments.subject: Re: On the road: St. Lou book signings

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article: If you're not going to be writing, you could maybe consider returning to Denver again? :)
comments.subject: Hmm...

comments.article: When will you be in St. Louis for the book signing?  Which Barnes & Noble?
comments.subject: St. Louis

comments.article: Aw, I was in Chicago this past weekend.. looks like I just missed you.
oh well, I'll never be living in a place where awesome authors come down to do signings and stuff until I'm out of college.
comments.subject: kansas...

comments.article: Hooray!  I can't wait to see you in Indy.  Nothing ever happens in the town I'm in, but I should be able to get that far at least.
oh my goodness i live in chicago!! YAY!!!

comments.upictitle: a pretty how town: pax pacis
comments.article:
Well, as much as I'd love Dance as quickly as possible, I'm excited to hear you're heading Midwest-erly again! Both Indy and Cincy are easy drives for me. I came to a book signing in November at Books & Company in Dayton - the Q&A was great - but of course when it was my turn in line, I forgot whatever, y'know, intelligent I was planning to say, and pretty much all that came out was, "Um, HI! I LOVE YOUR BOOKS!!" D'oh. :)

Safe travels, happy writing.

Don't forget to have a good time in your travels and take lots of pictures. Life is for living. Relax and enjoy! If I lived closer to the midwest (I'm in Texas) I'd try to get by for a signing. I'll wave in a northerly direction, though!
Hello Neighbor. I am just down the road from you. I hope it's OK if I friend you.

I'll admit that I wish you could do nothing but write as reading your works are truly one of the few joys in my life. However, I realize that this isn't possible. YOu only have one life so live it. I myself have a passion for miniatures so I understand where you are coming from. How could you pass up a chance to participate in something that you really love? I hope you have a great time.
btw, Have you ever taken a ride on the General Jackson? If not I highly recommend it.
Joe Beth in Cincinnati?  I only hope it's on a weekend so I can attend.
Swing by australia please :D

It's all right! don't worry about what people might think. go out and enjoy yourself. relax (or try to), have a good time, and return to your work fresh and vital. I bet the reading will be all the more fun then, lol.

despite that, we are all looking forward to your work.

health, (safe journey), and best wishes

adriane from germany
comments.subject: It's all right!

comments.article:
Oye...between your 'not a blog' and Neil Gaiman's journal, I'm getting a real frightening picture of just how hectic being a successful professional author can be.

Color me yellow...in neon.
Hey, you work hard.  Go ahead, have fun.  Maybe the little bit of fun you have will keep you from killing off some of my fav characters.
comments.subject: S'okay

comments.upictitle: Trista Bentleytonfarthingwhallop, Snark Pudding: The Trista - Purple Hair
comments.article: If you're going to be anywhere near the Twin Cities, DreamHaven in Minneapolis is a fantastic book shop for a reading or book signing. *hint hint*
Hi Trista! I am a fan and in Minneapolis also. DreamHaven has been a place for me to spend all of my money, but I love it. :p
Do you know which Borders in Chicago you will be at?

...someday, I'll be well-financed enough to afford a trip to see George in a book signing.

Enjoy the tour. :D
I am from the Columbus area and make it a point to visit Cincy for that festival yearly.  :D  Enjoy your travels!
